data.title: What Working for a Japanese Company Taught Me
data.meta_description: Back in the late 1970s, as a consultant to several Japanese computer giants, I read everything I could about Japanese business. It was all very interesting—interesting, but not particularly useful. When I became a line manager in 1981, I realized how little of what I’d read had any practical value. I couldn’t control interest rates, […]
data.text:
JR

John E. Rehfeld is president and chief operating officer of Seiko Instruments USA, Inc., of Torrance, California. From 1981 to 1989, he was vice president and general manager of Toshiba America’s computer business. Before that, he was a market-research consultant to Japanese high-technology companies.
